chapter.title: Working with Timers
chapter.para: The following sections describe how to configure and manage timers. An internal scheduler executes the timers. The following actions are supported in the Timers view:

sect1.title: Defining a Timer
sect1.para: You can define a new timer. You can configure the desired properties directly in the overview table.
Proceed as follows to create a new timer.

step.para: Switch to the Timers view.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Create
(Create).

result.para: A new entry with empty fields is created in the overview table. The ID field contains mandatory information and is therefore highlighted in red (marked as incorrect) while it does not contain a valid entry.

step.para: In the overview table, enter the desired settings for the new timer.

Click Save button
(Save) to save the new timer and exit the editing mode.

result.para: The editing mode is terminated and the new timer is displayed in the overview table.

step.para:
Click Cancel button
(Cancel) to cancel the creation of the timer and exit the editing mode without saving the timer.

sect1.title: Listing Timers
sect1.para: You can display an overview of the configured timers in the workspace of the Timers view.
The overview table displays the following information for each configured timer by default:

listitem.para: Contains information about additional values that are passed to the application in the task. Optional.
Application that is called when the timer task is started.
Reference to the trigger to which the timer is connected (for more information, see ). The trigger defines when and how often the timer task is started.

Specifies, whether the timer is enabled.. Valid available values are true (default) and false. With the value true, the timer task is started directly after being created. If the value is set to false, only the table entry is created.

sect1.title: Displaying Timer Details
sect1.para: You can display the details for a specific timer in the details pane. Currently, the details pane contains the same scope of information as the overview table.

sect1.title: Modifying a Timer
sect1.para: You can edit the timer properties.

note.para: Please keep in mind that you can not use this action to modify the timer name (ID). To change the timer name (ID), create a new timer with the desired name (see ).

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the values of an existing timer:

step.para: Switch to the Timers view.
Double-click the desired row in the overview table.

result.para: The entry switches to editing mode.

step.para: Enter the desired new values for the selected timer.

Click Save button
(Save) to save the timer with the updated values and exit the editing mode.

result.para: The editing mode is terminated and the timer is displayed with the updated values in the overview table.

step.para:
Click Cancel button
(Cancel) to cancel the timer update and exit the editing mode without saving the changes.

sect1.title: Modifying Multiple Timers
sect1.para: You can edit selected values for multiple timers in one step.

note.para: Please keep in mind that with this function, you define the same values for all selected timers.

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the settings of the selected timers.

step.para: Switch to the Timers view.
Select at least two timers from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the web interface, click Icon Edit
(Edit).
Tick the checkbox in front of each value you want to change for all selected timers.
In the Active field, specify whether the timer should be set active (value true) or inactive (value false).

note.para: This field allows you to enable or disable all selected timers in one step.

step.para: In the Configuration field, enter the configuration name.
In the Application field, specify the name of the application that is to be called.
In the Trigger field, specify the name of the trigger linked to the selected timers.
Click OK to save the changed settings for all selected directories and close the dialog.

result.para: The changed settings for the selected directories are displayed in the overview table and in the details pane.

step.para: Click Cancel to close the dialog without changing the settings.

sect1.title: Deleting a Timer
sect1.para: Use this action to delete a single timer or multiple timers. Proceed as follows to delete existing timers.

step.para: Switch to the Timers view.
Select at least one timer from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Delete
(Delete).

result.para: The confirmation dialog Delete Timers opens.

step.para: In the confirmation dialog Delete Timers, click OK to delete the selected timer (or timers).
In the confirmation dialog Delete Timers, click Cancel to close the dialog without deleting the selected timer(s).

result.para: If the timers have been successfully deleted, a success message is displayed.
If the timers could not be deleted, the corresponding error message is displayed.
